content:
I wanted to
Dance
But there
Was no
Music
Only the
Whisper
Of the
Wind
Which had
No tune
To it
I was bereft
For but
A second
And then
I heard it

The birds
Were singing
A #ballad
For me
And before
I knew
My feet
Began
To move
And soon
The rest
Followed

They turned
My malaise
Into melody
I turned
Their ballad
Into ballet
We made
Something
Together
The Flock
And I

#MastoPrompt #SmallPoems #Poetry #Ballad

content:
Continuing with what I think are the most useful facts from my textbook. Today, from Chapter 2, I really like the section explaining which outcome you should expect for your next study. It is much more likely to get a null effect than most researchers think when they begin a research project. Explicitly computing these probabilities protects against disappointment and imposter syndrome.

https://lakens.github.io/statistical_inferences/errorcontrol.html#which-outcome-can-you-expect-if-you-perform-a-study

account.note: Experimental Psychologist @TUeindhoven. Chair ERB. Seconded to @NWOnieuws, working on rewarding interdisciplanary research. Likes teaching statistics, bouldering, and walks with my wife and dog.

card.title: Chapter 2 Error control | Improving Your Statistical Inferences
card.description: In the previous chapter on p-values we have learned that in the Neyman-Pearson approach to hypothesis testing the goal is to make scientific claims while controlling how often you will make a fool...
